definition.en: This is a SKOS vocabulary version of the ISO19115-1 standard's AssociationType code list with code list extensions described in the GA Profile document http://pid.geoscience.gov.au/dataset/ga/122551.

historyNote.en: https://pid.geoscience.gov.au/dataset/ga/122551

definition.en: These terms describe the type of downhole construction in a borehole (eg, inlet screen, protection casing).
Describes the type of material used in downhole construction in a borehole (eg, PVC, steel, cement).
Purpose or intention for which the borehole was drilled. eg, exploration, development or production, geotechnical. Equivalent to PPDM Business Intention.

"Borehole status” information provided by Geoscience Australia (GA) is not guaranteed to be authoritative or current. GA is not a reporting or regulatory authority for borehole drilling, but it sources borehole information for its research purposes from various regulatory authorities in the States, Northern Territory and Commonwealth governments. The quality and currency of borehole status data in GA’s database reflects information gathered from a borehole operator’s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority on a particular date. Changes in a borehole’s status after GA sourced the borehole status information may not be reflected in GA’s data. Due to the wide variety of borehole types in GA’s database, GA’s vocabulary for “borehole status” is an amalgam of terms used by professional bodies (eg, PPDM, CoalLog) and regulatory authorities. Some of the terminology used across these professional domains and jurisdictions has varied over time, and in some cases the same term has a different meaning for different types of boreholes. GA has endeavoured to merge these sources of terminology into a consistent classification that applies for all borehole types.

definition.en: LEGACY GA Corporate Data Classification Scheme used 2005 - 2014

historyNote.en: CIMA information group

definition.en: A generic list of confidence levels.
Terms to describe the character of a contact between two geological units.

historyNote.en: Geoscience Australia Contact Character (FGDM.LU_contact-character)

definition.en: Type of contact that forms the top or base of a geological unit exposed in a borehole, measured section, or field site.

historyNote.en: Geoscience Australia Contact Type (FGDM.LU_LOCAL_contact_type)

definition.en: GA Country Codes are the ISO3166 compliant country codes used by GA database custodians for reference. This list is NOT complete and is maintained semi-regularly so there will be updates made in the ISO3166 that will not be reflected in this vocabulary. The controlled ISO3166 list is found here https://www.iso.org/obp/ui

historyNote.en: These codes are sourced from https://www.iso.org/obp/

definition.en: Terms to describe the confidence or quality in a recorded date
The type of North datum used for azimuth measurements (eg, true north, magnetic north, local grid north).
Terms to denote whether the directional survey is comprised of azimuth and inclination measurements, or only inclination measurements.
A vocabulary of common directional survey methods

prefLabel.en: Borehole Geology - Directional Survey Path Computing Method

definition.en: Terms to describe the geometric method used to calculate the survey path from the measured survey stations (eg, minimum curvature, offset survey).

prefLabel.en: Borehole Geology - Directional Survey Recording Mode

definition.en: Terms to describe the recording mode of the survey (eg, single-shot, multi-shot).
Method of drilling.

prefLabel.en: General Geology - Entity or Feature Type

definition.en: Type of entity or feature. (eg, measured section, borehole, field site).
The purpose of the field site (eg, geological study, geochemistry, neotectonics).

historyNote.en: Geoscience Australia Field Site Purpose Terms (FGDM. LU-FIELDSITE-PURPOSE)

definition.en: A site on the Earth, generally visited in the field from a particular geoscientific perspective. A field site type is defined by the information collected regarding rock, regolith, water, landform, or vegetation.

historyNote.en: Geoscience Australia Field Site Types (FGMD. LU-FIELDSITE-TYPE)

definition.en: This vocabulary is used to describe terms used for climate and disaster risk themes, covering hazard, exposure, vulnerability, impact, climate, weather and geophysical disasters

historyNote.en: Combination of WMO, UNDRR and AIDR definitions agreed between GA, BoM, ABS and CSIRO

definition.en: A vocabulary of landform types used in GA Boreholes database. Reference Pain CF, 2008. Field Guide for Describing Regolith and Landforms. ISBN 978-0-9806030-0-2.

historyNote.en: Geoscience Australia Landform type (FGDM. LU_landform_type)

definition.en: Legislative or administrative frameworks under which drilling is performed.
Method used to estimate the location of a point. eg, satellite navigation, estimation from printed maps or aerial photography.
Broad categories of earth materials (eg, rock, sediment, water, vegetation) that may be observed or sampled.

prefLabel.en: Mineral Resources - Mining Waste Status Types

definition.en: Terms that describe the storage type a mining waste feature may have.

historyNote.en: This vocabulary is drawn from a Geoscience Australia Mineral Resources database table (OZMIN.LU_WASTE_STATUS)

definition.en: Terms that describe the storage type a mining waste feature may have.

definition.en: Mode of occurrence of geological units and samples (eg: dyke, bed, phenocryst).

historyNote.en: Geoscience Australia Mode of Occurrence (FGDM.MODE_OCCURENCES)

definition.en: OnLine Function Type
A vocabulary of terms defining petrophysical properties (eg, density, porosity, magnetic susceptibility, remanent magnetisation).

The proportion of an observed or sampled feature that is comprised by one or more earth materials. The vocabulary also provides approximate numeric percent ranges that correspond to the qualitative terms

historyNote.en: Geoscience Australia Proportion Terms (FGDM.LU_PROPORTION_TERMS)

definition.en: Indicates the status of whether or not QA of the data for this record has been undertaken (C - Checked, U - Unchecked).

The form, shape, purpose, or environment of a collected specimen or observation. Where possible the sample type description is independent of the material that comprises the specimen (eg, rock, oil, sand), or the sampling method (eg, drilling, dredging), but in practice it is not always possible or convenient to completely separate these concepts from the sample type (eg, water column specimen).
Method by which a physical specimen was obtained, or may indicate that a feature was only observed and not physically sampled.

A vocabulary of general terms used in the two-part marine and coastal geomorphology classification scheme (International Seabed Geomorphology Mapping Working Group - ISGM-WG: Part 1 Morphology: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940); Part 2 Geomorphology: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019)).

This is one of four linked ISGM-WG vocabularies. Definitions in this vocabulary are subject to intermittent review and versioning.

historyNote.en: This vocabulary describes the glossary in Part 2 of the two-part seabed geomorphology classification scheme DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.7804019

definition.en:
A vocabulary of MORPHOLOGY FEATURE (Part 1) terms used in the two-part marine and coastal geomorphology classification scheme (International Seabed Geomorphology Mapping Working Group - ISGM-WG: Part 1 Morphology: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940); Part 2 Geomorphology: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019)) to describe the shape of the seabed.

This is one of four linked ISGM-WG vocabularies. Definitions in this vocabulary are subject to intermittent review and versioning. Unless otherwise stated, all definitions are derived from the Part 1 Morphology report (Version 2.0 [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940)).

historyNote.none:
"2025-08 1.1: Images added

This vocabulary describes the glossary in Part 1 of the two-part seabed geomorphology classification scheme. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo4075248

definition.en:
A vocabulary of physiographic terms used by Harris et al (2014:[https://doi.org/10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011)) to map the macroscale shape and geology of the seabed. Many of these terms have been retained by the International Seabed Geomorphology Mapping Working Group (ISGM-WG)  in this PHYISOGRAPHY vocabulary, and some have been shifted into either Part 1 Morphology or Part 2 Geomorphology vocabularies, as indicated (Part 1 Morphology: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940); Part 2 Geomorphology:[https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019)).

This vocabulary comprises one of four linked ISGM-WG vocabularies.

historyNote.en: This vocabulary describes the glossary in Part 2 of the two-part seabed geomorphology classification scheme DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.7804019

definition.en:
A vocabulary of GEOMORPHIC UNIT terms (Part 2) used in the two-part marine and coastal geomorphology classification scheme (International Seabed Geomorphology Mapping Working Group - ISGM-WG: Part 1 Morphology: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4071940); Part 2 Geomorphology: [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019) to classify MORPHOLOGY FEATURES (Part 1) with their process interpretation. These UNIT terms are structured within a consistent framework design that is replicated between eleven SETTING and PROCESS categories.

This is one of four linked ISGM-WG vocabularies. Definitions in this vocabulary are subject to intermittent review and versioning. Unless otherwise stated, all definitions are derived from the Part 2 Geomorphology report (Version 1.0) [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7804019)).

historyNote.en: This vocabulary describes the glossary in Part 2 of the two-part seabed geomorphology classification scheme DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.7804019

prefLabel.en: Boreholes Organic Geochemistry - Source Rock Quality

definition.en: The quality of source rock from which organic chemistry samples were obtained.
Statistical qualifier for rock property measurements (e.g. mean, maximum, median).

prefLabel.en: Geology Rock Properties - Statistical Uncertainty Type

definition.en: The type of statistical uncertainty for rock property measurements (e.g. 1 sigma, 2 sigma, 99 percent confidence, unknown).

prefLabel.en: Geoscience Australia Profile of QUDT Units

definition.en: A vocabulary of Units from the QUDT ontology used by Geoscience Australia.

historyNote.en: This vocabulary is a subset of the QUDT Units of Measure at http://www.qudt.org/doc/DOC_VOCAB-UNITS.html
